text:
We just arrived and I already hate it.
C'mon, let's get outta here.
So a little sightseeing couldn't hurt, could it?

I mean, c'mon, we're in Costa del Sol, people!
Costa. Del. Sol!
Perhaps we could find some shade first?

Greetings and welcome to Costa del Sol!
I'm Kapono, the mayor here.
A gift to get you in the mood.
After all, there's nothing like a good lei to kick-start your getaway!
That color really brings out your eyes!
A shimmering seaside paradise awaits you─with only the bluest skies, and earthly delights on all sides.
So forget your dead-end nine-to-fives, 'cause here, the fun lasts all the way to sunrise!
Welcome to wonderland, my fair ladies!

Yeah, but let's find a hotel and shower first.
Then we can go.
You better not be suggestin' we all hit the beach.

Hey... Hey, I saw that! Don't go thinkin' I didn't.
You two said it with your eyes!
No, forget I asked. I don't need to know and I definitely don't want to know.
I'm looking after one of the execs on some very important business, so please just stay out of our way.
Many who were in Junon for the inauguration decided to extend their vacation here.
They've filled up our most popular hotels.
I could direct you to a recently opened establishment...
but between you and me, you should steer clear of that place─and its new owner.

I'm terribly sorry,
but we're all booked up for the evening.
We're only accepting customers with prior reservations today.
We hope to see you again soon.
Hey, pretty boy. Ever thought about owning a piece of real estate in paradise?
I've got a hotel for ten percent the market price!
Owner must be out of his mind tryin' to sell the place, but you know how rich folks are.
Whaddya say? In a hot spot like this, you'll make your money back in no time!
Same to you. So...what're you doing here?
Bein' the owner of a bona fide hotel!

What a coincidence! We were just looking for
a place to stay. Do you have any rooms?

Do I have rooms? I got rooms for days!
Enough rooms to make your head spin!
That's what happens when you have no guests.

No need to be shy. We go way back, right?
It's the least I can do.
Alright, let's get you settled in.

Make sure you stick close!
Can't have my guests gettin' lost!
Just bought the place, so I'm still doin' repairs here 'n' there, but all things considered, it's lookin' pretty sweet.

How I got my hands on it though─hoo-hoo,
now that's a story.

I was cursed with the unholy trinity.
No job, no money, and worst of all, no girl.

I was a nobody with nothin'─walkin' garbage.
But Mayor Kapono believed in me.
Said I was destined to make somethin' of myself, so he sold me a hotel for cheap!

"How cheap," you ask? Half market price cheap!
The dude even loaned me the money for it!
There's no kinder man in all the world.
Behold my pride and joy: Johnny's Seaside Inn!

Maybe my eyes are failin' me,
but I don't see no "seaside."
It's not about the sights, but the smells.
Ah, how that fresh salt air tickles the nose.
Okay! Let's get everyone checked in!

Tifa, you'll be staying in Room 101.
Aerith, you're in 102.
As for the dudes... You can all bunk together in 103.
I'd never even think of charging you! Besides─

Ah, I gotta run.
The mayor requires my assistance at this time.

Make yourselves at home!
Not like there's anyone else here anyway.

You guys better not head to
the beach lookin' like that!

And don't even think of bringin'
those weapons with ya!
Fate is so cruel, depriving me of Tifa in beachwear!
Soon enough. No need to stick to a schedule here.

Think I'll go take a walk.
Though...I should maybe get changed first.
Well ventilated, plenty of shade... A lovely hotel.
Uh... This looks like it'll collapse if I try to sit on it, much less sleep...
C'mon! Why you gotta do me like that, shower!?
Hold down the fort till I get back.
What's a stand-up guy like you stayin' at a dump like this for? I could show ya somewhere way better.
Whole building's barely worth a hundred gil, and yet the owner's drowning in debt to keep it open.
Takes a special kind of sucker to wind up in a mess like that, y'know?
Hang loose! Don't tell me you're alone.

The beach is for partying!
And one's not a party─it's a pity!
But you don't have to be lonely any longer.
We're bringing people together─solo suntanners like you─with a special event!
One we guarantee will spice up your social life!
Find love at Costa del Amor!
Find love at Costa del Amor!
So? Will you be joining us or what?
Got plans with those guys. Later.

So they're friends of yours?
Then can you do us a solid?
Those robed people are a little different, right? And they've kinda been creeping the other guests out.
I mean, look at their clothes─they kill the vibe.

So if you could get them outta here,
we'd be so grateful!
Speaking of clothes... They'll never let you on the beach looking like that.

This is Costa del Sol! You gotta loosen up─
let it all out!

And to help you with that...
here's lucky ticket number seven!
With that, you can play Pirate's Rampage and Card Carnival─but not all by your lonesome.

Your number's the same as someone else's.
Find them, and you've got yourself a team!

Work together, master the games,
and you'll earn companion cards!
You can turn those in for beachwear.

And once you're dressed to impress,
you'll finally be ready to hit the beach!
So start searching, and let the fun begin!
Best of luck finding that special someone!
No beachwear, no beach. Those are the rules.
If you want to head down to the beach, you'll need to change first!
No getting around the dress code, I guess.
Duh duhn-duhn, duh-duhn, duhn duh-duhn duh duhn-duhn♪

Hey, Cloud. Want some ice cream to cool down?
Or are you lookin' for somethin' hot?
Just admit it. You're obviously captivated by my bodacious beach bod.

"You're obviously captivated by
my bodacious beach bod."
C'mon. Can't you take a hint?

Wait─you are?
I, uh, didn't expect you to have an eye for beauty.
But! Don't forget that I'm more than just a pretty face. Are you sure you don't want me on your team?
"Nope," he says. "Not interested"! But that whole shtick doesn't make you cool!
But if you were to hire yours truly as your Counselor of Cool, I could show you how it's done!
C'mon. Can't you take a hint?
Hmph. I have no idea what you're talking about.
But if I was part of the group, I'm sure we'd learn to communicate much better.

Think of the comic relief I'd bring to the team!
As well as some much-needed youthful energy.

Think of the comic relief I'd bring to the team!
As well as some much-needed youthful energy.
They're gettin' some sun too, huh?
Just can't help but feel sorry for 'em, y'know?

Poor bastards ain't done nothin' to nobody...
but we treat 'em like monsters all the same.
Thanks for keeping watch. I'll only be a sec.

Uh... Well, the water won't turn off.
Johnny sure found himself a real fixer-upper.
Tell me: what color would you say this is?
Thing is, it used to be white.
At least, it was back in Midgar...

Materia is formed from the lifestream itself─
orbs infused with knowledge, memories...
The Whispers...they took all that from mine?

Weren't you headed to the beach?
Some time with Tifa might lift your spirits.

Wandering around alone would be ill-advised.
I insist you take Tifa.

Hey, Tifa, you ready to soak up the sun?
'Cause I sure am.
Now let's find us some resort wear.
And then we can finally hit the beach!
Hang loose! You ladies look like you're on the way down to the water.

If you're in the market for some beach attire,
why not participate in Costa del Amor?

A special event that'll make
your time here unforgettable!
And don't worry: your pet can join too!
Well, in that case, sign me up!
Perfect! Then here's one ticket for the two of you.

you can run wild on the pet playground,
ride around on wheelies, or...uh...

Oh! There's also the photo contest,
and you can't miss the piano recital!
So go out there and be sure to have yourselves a ball!
You wanna take the lead for a bit?
Come on, Johnny boy! You can still make it in time!
He said he was coming by boat. So much for that!
And then he expects me to drop everything because he arrived three hours early!
Would it have killed them to tell me about all of these changes ahead of time?
We're expecting a very special Shinra client, so I came to offer an official welcome.
Perhaps I'll just head to the hotel and get the room ready.
I wonder what kinda guy this "bigwig" is.
Well...already checked into the hotel, apparently.
Tifa? Aerith? What're the two of you doin' here?
That's our question. And what's with the bag?
Luggage for a Shinra executive. Gotta make sure it gets to his hotel safe and sound...
You're working for Shinra now? After all that talk about how much you hate them?
After everything he's done for me, I gotta.

Don't look at me like that!
I'm not some...some sellout!
Do you even have to ask?
Well, Red? How do we look?
Tifa, you look...as sleek as a dolphin.
Tifa looks...as majestic as a breaching whale.
And Aerith as...diaphanous as a jellyfish.
And you, Aerith...are as luminous as a sea snail.
That your way of complimenting us?
Human beauty is...hard for me to assess.
Look at these two, not even tryin' to blend in. Honestly...
Speaking of which, you guys should probably put on...s-sunscreen.
Sunscreen? Is that really all you have to say to us?
That's some sage advice, Mr. Pasty.
Okay. Can you get my back then?
What a wonderful surprise it is to see you again.
Rest assured, I'm not here for Aerith.

Though, were she to offer her assistance,
I'd gladly accept.
Oh, I won't. At any rate...
a very "special" show is about to start.
So, what say you? Care to join me in the lab? If you girls sign up with Shinra, you'll be set for life!
And, as luck would have it, I'm in need of a few female assistants.
Think about it: you could help give birth to the world's next hero!
Before a hero strikes down his foe, he must strike them with awe at his beauty.
But he is not a "hero" by virtue of innate greatness. Only by inspiring others does he earn the title.
Do you follow? It's admittedly a lofty concept.
Too lofty for me, but it sounds amazing!
I'm afraid this area has been reserved.
There you are, Professor! So glad you could make it. I trust my girls are making you feel welcome?
There's nothing sexier than a man in a white coat.
Say, Professor. How about I polish those glasses for you?
Care to savor some of the local delicacies, Professor? Here─open wide!
So you heeded the call too, did you?
As you can see, your brothers down there are having a little get-together.
What the hell are you playin' at?

That, my friends, is for me to know...
and for you to find out!
Wha─! Not cool, man! Not cool!
Yes, yes! Only a reunion could produce such results!
At long last, I have specimens worthy of my attention!
How serendipitous! Our Ancient, returned to the fold.
We're so glad you changed your mind, Aerith.

Might you be interested in
bringing a new hero to life?
You aren't the specimen I was seeking, but I'm sure the data you'll provide will be fascinating nonetheless.
I ask your compliance, future specimens. For the sake of the scientific process.
Unlike my colleagues, I've no desire to pursue fairy tales.
My interest in you, Aerith, is purely structural─cellular, to be precise.
A pity you did not inherit more of your mother's physical characteristics. That woman was gorgeous right down to her genes!
If it isn't Specimen 13! Still sprightly as ever, I see.
Perhaps you've forgotten the tricks I taught you? Reeducation may be in order then.

Oho! And then there was one.
Come along quietly now!

Might you be interested in
bringing a new hero to life?
That's all of them. And thus I take my leave.
That thing's not gonna go down easy.
But I've got an idea. Do me a favor─keep it busy!
I did this... This is all my fault...

You wanna help 'em, don'tcha?
Then you'd better hold still!
Let him go. We've done enough.
It's because of Hojo this place is in ruins.
No... I can't blame him for our actions. I know I should strive to maintain my composure around him, but...

"I know I should strive to maintain
my composure around him, but..."

Don't sweat it. Anyone would wanna
punch that smug asshole. I know I do.

We had no choice. Things would've turned out
worse if we hadn't stepped in.

Yeah, you should.
You could've handled things better back there.
You should go check on the others.

Hate to say it, but that girl really
came through for us back there.

Unlike me.
I couldn't do a damn thing for those poor bastards.

"I couldn't do a damn thing
for those poor bastards."
You tried. That's all you can do.
You tried. That's all you can do─and all that matters if you ask me.

You trying to cheer me up?
Now I've seen everything.
You shouldn't blame yourself. This is on Hojo.
Damn straight. That asshole's gotta pay for his sins─and it's up to us to make sure he does!
Can't save everyone. Mighta just been their time.
You kiddin' me? That right there's an excuse─fatalistic bullshit folks use to make themselves feel better.
Hope I get to bring Marlene here someday... I know she'd love it.
Couldn't find the bartender, so I, uh, helped myself.

Used to make 'em back at the bar, and here I am─
drinking one in its namesake.

Feels like it's been ages since I mixed a drink─
since Seventh Heaven.
"Feels like it's been ages since Seventh Heaven."
A lot─good and bad... Ever wish you could just snap your fingers and forget the worst stuff?
It's a part of who we are. Whether we like it or not.

Yeah...
The deepest wounds never really heal.
But I also know I have to move on. At least for now.
No telling what the future holds for us.
It was a figure of speech.
Hey, I can make one for you too, if you want.

Next time I ask for a cocktail,
it'll be at the new Seventh Heaven.
At least, that's what I promised Barret.
And when exactly did you promise him that?
Alright, Mr. Secretive, you do you.
Hope I can come back here someday. Stare at the ocean. Listen to the waves...

We've come so far...
but it still feels like Midgar's right behind us.
We were his prisoners. Me and my mom─Ifalna.

He kidnapped us because she was a Cetra─
a "specimen" for his experiments. And after what he did to her...

After all the pain and the horror he put us through...
I hate him.

Sometimes...I imagine the things I'd do to him
if I got the chance...

I start thinking things so dark and ugly that...
it scares me.

"I start thinking things so
dark and ugly that it scares me."
They're just thoughts. Let 'em be dark 'n' ugly.
Everybody's got someone they hate. It's normal.

What I'm tryin' to say is...
worry about the future when it comes.
And whatever you decide, I'm with you.
No need to worry about the future till it comes.
And when it does, I'll be counting on you.
Not you. That was to her─my future self.

Can't say when you'll meet, but trust me,
you'll love her.
It's moments like these we have to hold on to.
Late to the party once again... Why do I even bother? I'm finished.
No...the company can't fire me if...if I fire myself first! Y'hear that!? I quit!
Hey, Rufus! Take your mako and shove it up your ass!
Fair enough. Gotta make the most of these moments.
Well, guess this ends our fun in the sun.
Yeah. Though "fun" ain't the word I'd use.
You're the man of the hour.
I dunno... Ya see, a few kind girls who saw what happened on the beach gave me the lowdown...
Ugh... I'm a moron... How could I be so blind?

You borrowed a lot of money from him, right?
Will you be able to pay it back?
The girls told Kapono, "Keep leechin' off our hero and we'll smear your name so bad, Shinra'll kick you to the curb!"
And the crazy thing is, it worked. He caved.
I am footloose and debt-free, baby!
Proprietor of the Seaside Inn─soon-to-be seven-star resort hotel!

Ya know ya gotta get one star before
you can get the other six, right?
Very funny, but I got plans─
Now watch him fall up the stairs.
Nah, I should be the one thanking you.

Oh, those dudes shuffled off
toward Mt. Corel this morning.

Tried to get the injured ones to stay
till they were healthy, but...
Be safe, you guys! Wouldn't want anything to happen to my inaugural guests. Bon voyage!
As the phoenix rises from the ashes, so too shall my hotel rise from obscurity!
But yeah, if you ever need to take a load off, just use whatever rooms're open.
Always happy to help my one true bro!
Uh, hello? Aren't you all forgetting about someone?

Some know me as the world's greatest
materia hunter.
And the rest, a benevolent and beautiful ninja!
Wutai's white rose─the one and only Yuffie!
Hey! Hold it, you spiky-haired jerkface!

Where do ya think you're goin'!?
I challenge you to a duel!
If I win, you get the honor of serving yours truly!
However─if you manage to somehow fluke your way to victory, this amazing ninja will agree to join you.

I mean, uh...we don't actually have to fight.
That is, unless you really want to?

Oh. It's like that, huh?
Where's your pride? Your fighting spirit!?

What's the matter?
Afraid you're about to catch a beatdown?
"Afraid you're about to catch a beatdown?"

I mean, uh...we don't actually have to fight.
That is, unless you really want to?
Of course you are. I mean, who wouldn't be intimidated by my awesome ninja skills?

For I, the most beguiling of ninjas,
will be your new best friend!
Oh really? Fine then! It's your loss!

Well, seeing as you're so desperate,
I guess I'll oblige ya.
H-hey! Where do you think you're going!?
Think this through... Are you absolutely, one hundred percent certain you don't want me around to save your butts?

"You don't want me around
to save your butts?"

Well, seeing as you're so desperate,
I guess I'll oblige ya.
Fine then! I know when to take a hint. You don't want me? I'll leave.
And you'll never, ever see me again!

I was joking! You gotta believe me!
Please let me be one of the gang!
If you really wanna, I won't stop you.

Well, seeing as you're so desperate,
I guess I'll oblige ya.
I'll shove you in the Sister Ray, point it at Wutai, and blast you back home.

You won't regret this, or my name isn't
Yuffie Kisaragi!
Ah, you'll be fine. Fresh air, nice view...!
Not unless you enjoy starin' at ruined reactors.
Right... You grew up around here, didn't you?

Materia's, like...
super-condensed mako or something, right?

So...that means, wherever we find mako...
we'll find materia too!
Alright! Timeout's over, team! Let's go!
You know, Yuffie, when you're part of a team, you can't just do whatever you feel like.
What? So does that mean I gotta run everything by you first?
So that's the game... Fine. Permission to sing, sir?
Permission to scratch my back, sir?
Permission to blow my nose, sir?
Whoops! Didn't get permission to yawn yet!
Well? Do I get permission or not?
Sure! You can do it while you're warmin' the bench!
That's an abuse of power! Tyrant! Tyrant!

Tifa, tell me your secret.
How d'you put up with this jerkface?
His good qualities outweigh the bad.

Yeah? By how much?
Like, 51% good guy to 49% jerkface?
Maybe a little more than that.
So, what, like a...fifty-five, forty-five split?
Think Aerith might need a break.

But if we stop now, the materia─
I mean the mystery men─might slip away!

Hey, I know what to do!
I'll go on ahead, and scout the area for us!
You guys can catch up later. Well, see ya!

Think I'd better go keep an eye on them.
Barret's not himself right now, y'know?
Take your time, okay? No need to rush.
Yeah, feelin' great, actually! Could do this all day!
It's like...it's like someone's pulling me up!
You've become one with the mountain.

Really? I did?
Hey, thanks for having me!
The hell are you doin', Red?
Relax. It happens to all new climbers. If she passes out, I'll carry her.
I tell ya, hikers these days ain't got no manners.
Ya greet each other. It's proper!
Well, I'll be. Finally, folks who've got some manners.
I don't get it. Tons of folks hikin' up the mountain today, and not a one of 'em so much as nodded my way.
Even tried calling out to a few sick-looking fellas all in black, and what'd I get? Silence.

...Hikers these days never learn
to greet each other or somethin'?

Ran into a sprightly little lady too.
Now she was in a real hurry.
Must've been tryin' to stay ahead of that angry-lookin' fella with the pretty gal.
Mountain ain't no place to be runnin' races, I'll tell ya that.
Uh-oh. Think the others are okay?
You here to pick a fight?
Just dropping off some unruly passengers.

They were fine when we left Junon...
and then they weren't...so, here we are.

Dunno why.
One minute they were okay, and the next...
Eh, whatever. This is way above my pay grade.

We'd love to stay and chat,
but Rude and I are busy people.

She'll be more than happy to
keep you company, though!
Guess the Turks're back on duty, huh?
Come on. We need to find the others.

The next order of business is
the Magnus Materia Project.
As you are aware, simultaneous energy spikes were detected in mako reactors across the world.
After analyzing the data from each site...
we found the spikes stemmed from the arrival of visitors─unfathomably large life-forms.
Based on available information, it would seem so.
They supposedly appear when the planet is in danger.
And each one carries an enormous orb of materia.

More specifically,
an orb from which they themselves were born.
They are living enigmas─organisms dying to be understood, and finally my dream of capturing one is within reach!

Oh, what I wouldn't give to peel one's flesh back,
pull it apart...and see what makes it tick!
Your wish, Professor, will soon be granted.
We'll all get what we want once that materia is ours.
Why waste time monster hunting when we're on the brink of creating the materia ourselves?
I am aware of your efforts.

But it would behoove us to obtain
naturally occurring specimens as well.
Well, they would look good in the lobby!

Put them in the bathroom for all I care.
Just leave me the carcasses─those I'll take.
Mr. President, please. What is this really about?
Well, talk about burying the lede.
My finest for the madam director.

There's a question I never had the chance
to ask your father.
Perhaps you could speak on his behalf?
We used Avalanche's activities as a cover to sabotage our own reactors and destroy Sector 7.
Your father assured us these acts were in service to the Neo Midgar Project.
However, the fact remains that we have yet to locate the "promised land" of legend, or even confirm if it actually exists.
Great though he was, my father was old.
And in his dotage, he became rash.

But while we're on the subject,
there's something I've been meaning to ask all of you regarding those decisions.
Why is it that none of you even tried to stop him?
Shinra must change. We must break new ground─grow stronger. Smarter...
My father built his empire with your loyal support. And I demand the same.
I expect you all to prove that you are devoted not only to the company, but to me.
Hey, which way do you think Midgar is?
It would be east of here.
I wonder how my mom's doing back there.

She seemed fine when I saw her.
Maybe a little worried.
She's gonna hate me for this.

Talk to her as soon as you get home.
She'll understand.
Really looking forward to that conversation.
Yup! Really worked up a sweat!
All clear! No nasty surprises. And...no materia.

We managed to catch her before
she could get as far as the reactor.

Which is the whole reason we're here! So hurry it up
or those hooded guys'll beat us to it!

Hey...so, what's the deal with all these
creepy hooded guys anyway?

Huh...
Well, they're in good company, I'll give 'em that.

When Shinra invaded Wutai,
it was...pretty bad.

And when the dust settled,
they forced some B.S. truce on us.
I thought both sides wanted a cease-fire.
The old geezers at the top did, yeah...
but the rest of us were pissed! They'd been running Wutai into the ground for years...
It was the last straw─we were done!
Everyone was ready to kick those old farts to the curb. And that's when Colonel Lodbrok's team showed up...
Three ex-SOLDIERs, ready to join the cause!

Lodbrok! His squad saved Wutai from those
senile old fossils─paved the way forward!
They didn't do it alone, though. While the colonel's crew was rallyin' the people, their friend Viceroy Sarruf agreed to help.
Then bam! Revolution. And that is how the interim government was born.
Because...once this war with Shinra's behind us, the whole country's gonna come together and decide what kinda government we want.
Which is why we're doing everything we can to make sure the interim ends in independence.
Just gonna stand there? Let's get goin'!
So, like, all that stuff down there is mako?
Then it's gotta be hiding some ginormous materia!
Woohoo! Oh, I'm gonna be so powerful it's scary!
Tutelary creatures said only to appear when the planet is in grave danger.
Hojo has sought them for years.
Did you see what was inside it!?
That had to've been the biggest freakin' materia ever!

Just gotta figure out how to catch
that overgrown fish.

Whatever! I'm not about to let a materia that beautiful get away! And just so we're clear,
it's mine─I called it!
Cool. You fish. We'll keep moving.

This isn't goodbye, sweet Weapon!
I'll be back for you soon!
A "guardian beast" like that wouldn't show up unless Shinra had really pushed the planet to the edge.
Meaning...Avalanche was right about the threat they posed all along. We were, weren't we?
Yeah. But don't forget: Shinra's not the only problem.
Right. Sephiroth is still out there.
He is. And talking won't stop him.
For now. Can't cross till we lower it.
Control room's up there, at the top of the cliff.

Won't be a walk in the park though.
Place's been abandoned for years.
We're workin' on it! Just wait a minute!

Perhaps the mako got to him.
Regardless, he's clearly tired.
Cloud could rest here while a couple of us go and lower the bridge, yeah?

When that thing rings, you'll know we're done.
And you don't move till you're good and ready.
Alright, put on your minin' helmets and follow me!
I'll be okay. Just gimme a minute.
Our black-clad friends mean to swim across the river, but I see no reason not to use the bridge.

Up─with that thing.
But we're gonna have to power it on first.
The generator's just across the way.

Gotta use that grappling hook.
Shouldn't be a problem for you, right?
Gonna need someone to unlock this thing from the control unit upstairs.
Why do I gotta do all the work?
Hey, hey, check out its head!
Does it remind you of anyone!?
That settles it! I hereby dub thee, Cloud Jr.!

Hey, we could take that minecart down─
save ourselves a hike.

Not the smoothest ride, but it sure is fast.
Me and Dyne used to...

Forget it. Let's just lower the bridge and
get back to the others.
Okay! One of these buttons oughta do it.

Right. Now that the bridge is good to go,
let's touch base with the others.

Hello, hello! This is Special Agent Yuffie!
Can you read me, Commander Cloud?
We'll take a cart back down. You three follow the tracks till you hit the bridge into town.

Figure we link up there before heading in.
You copy?
Oh, and set our route while you're at it, will ya?

The gentler the ride, the better.
Don't want anyone losin' their lunch.
